body:
David Kuntz

5337 1st Ave S. Minneapolis, MN 55419 | dkuntz811@gmail.com
612-799-6977

OBJECTIVE:

To utilize the skills I've developed as an educator to complete the courses at Prime and use my new found profiency to begin my career in software development.

EXPERIENCE

Benilde-St. Margaret's School

February 2000 to Present

  • Developed curriculum and taught United States History for 7th and 8th graders (American-Indian history/culture to modern times), Genocide and Social Justice (a course designed to encourage students to examine their responsibility to address global issues through the study of the Darfur Genocide and the 1994 Genocide in Rwanda), and the American Experience (a team-taught course combining a thematic approach to history and literature that includes experiential travel opportunities to the Civil Rights South, Northern Minnesota, and Washington DC.

Experiental Learning Development

2002 to Present

  • Researched, organized, developed and led annual experiential learning opportunities for middle school students to Boston, MA, Washington DC, a Civil Rights Tour of the Southern States and Northern Minnesota.
  • Researched, organized, developed curricula and led an experiential learning opportunity for high school students in Rwanda to examine the 1994 Genocide and experience Rwandan culture in 2009, 2011, and 2013.

EDUCATION

University of San Diego

1996 to 1998

  • Earned a Master of Arts degree in History, completing both the Public History and Teaching options.
  • Helped to develop the permanent exhibit, Charting the Sea: Technology and History of Navigation at the San Diego Maritime Museum.
  • Researched and completed the thesis, Max Watson: San Diego City Forester, 1910-1916

Colorado State University

1992 to 1996

  • Earned a Bachelor of Art's degree in History.
  • Member of Phi Alpha Theta, History Honor Society.

KEY QUALIFICATIONS

I am strongly motivated to be accepted in and complete Prime's coursework and have the patience, drive, and excitement to do so.

I have worked for sixteen years in education and well versed in collaborative work, especially with the millennial generation.

I have developed curricula for multiple courses including experiential learning opportunities both domestic and international.

I have vast experience in developing learner assessments that measure projected outcomes.

I have worked in a one to one laptop program for ten years which has included developing online learning activities, informal and formal assessments, and have utilized several learning management systems.
